body: I also have the same issue with the new beta release.

Thanks for the clarification @jeylau. That brings me onto my error (sorry Antoine for hijacking this thread a bit, perhaps you will have the same issue?):- 
When running the X-validation code (after the initial evaluation) an error is thrown that seems to traceback to a missing 'inferencebounds.yaml' file, screenshot below.

code run: 
`deeplabcut.evaluate_network(config_file, plotting=True, show_errors=True)
deeplabcut.evaluate_multianimal_crossvalidate(config_file, Shuffles=[1], edgewisecondition=True, leastbpts=1, init_points=20, n_iter=50)


![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54323442/83013513-0f51d500-a015-11ea-83df-a3ab4b6e9a3a.png)

@AntoineCribel - the stats are printed in the terminal after x-eval; Please see the docs here:  https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/blob/master/docs/functionDetails.md#cross-validation-of-inference-parameters-a-madeeplabcut-critical-point

```
Saving optimal inference parameters...
   train_iter  train_frac  shuffle  rmse_train  hits_train  misses_train  falsepos_train  ndetects_train  pck_train  rpck_train  rmse_test  hits_test  misses_test  falsepos_test  ndetects_test  pck_test  rpck_test
0     50000.0        95.0      1.0   36.681365     9.89759     11.645783         0.63494        1.761446   0.306809    0.288352   33.81332      8.675       13.025           0.45          1.625  0.286614   0.264459
```

Also, @AntoineCribel - please definitely check out the video tutorials, they are only ~10 min but take you through the whole process. Multi-animal is more complicated, but I tried hard to make it as straight forward as possible with the GUI, docs, and videos :) 

https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/blob/master/docs/UseOverviewGuide.md#important-information-on-using-deeplabcut

rename.from: Where to find evaluation results (missing .csv file)

GPU: RTX 2070 8GB
code run: `deeplabcut.evaluate_multianimal_crossvalidate(config_file, Shuffles=[1], edgewisecondition=True, leastbpts=1, init_points=20, n_iter=50)`

thanks! can you confirm this file is indeed there? 
`/home/mccaffertylab/Documents/DLC-projects/4_Mouse_OFT-Katie-2020-05-24/dlc-models/iteration-0/4_Mouse_OFTMay24-trainset95shuffle1/test/inferencebounds.yaml`

and that in dlc-models, .. you have snapshots?

Thanks for the quick reply.
There is no 'inferencebounds.yaml' file in any subdirectory (there is 'inference_cfg.yaml' under the "models/iteration/name/test" folder). Is this something that the user needs to create? If so I apologise and must have missed that in the docs.

dlc-models sub-dir has all the expected snapshots, as well as 'pose_cfg.yaml', 'log.txt','learning_stats.csv', 'checkpoint', and a log folder.

For multi animal projects, when one creates a training set `inference_cfg.yaml `will be created automatically along with `pose_cfg.yaml` based on default variables in https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/blob/master/deeplabcut/inference_cfg.yaml

The user can of course edit those values, and cross-validation during evaluation will also update them.

Thanks @HenryDarch - okay, odd this is happening. Typically it is created at the evaluation step, and found here:
![Screen Shot 2020-05-27 at 4 59 42 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28102185/83071758-a03ba700-a03b-11ea-8245-cadf2cf7734a.png)

Could you re-run the "evaluate" step, and then x-val again? (and if you are on Windows, be sure you open the terminal "as an admin" just in case some funny permission issue with writing the file)

No change when pre-running evaluation. I'll try re-creating the project, perhaps in a fresh environment. 
Feel free to close this as the original question has been answered. I'll create a dedicated issue if my bug persists. :)
